revised_title: Supravital Staining of Osteoclasts and Bone Growth in Mice
tldr: The author studied the distribution and behavior of osteoclasts in the parietal bones of normal growing mice using supravital staining with neutral-red. They found that the staining reaction varied between individual cells and provided insights into the origin and fate of osteoclasts. The author also compared the distribution of osteoclasts in normal and mutant mice, such as grey-lethal and hydrocephalus-3, and observed differences in their number and size. This research contributes to our understanding of bone growth and development.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
